name: HouseCarlin
_source: s;CarlinGrandpa;Carlin...{w} you're still alive...{w} oh, thank Heavens...
s;Carlin;Never mind me!{w} Come on, we gotta go!{w} The whole town's gone to hell!
s;CarlinGrandpa;I know, boy, I...{w} I know.
s;CarlinGrandpa;...{w} I have something for you.{w} Something I've been...{w} meaning to return.
s;SCarlinGrandpa;Now, plant your feet, like so, and intone the incantation.{w} Keep your voice steady and low -{w} don't let it waver.{w} Do you understand?
s;SCarlin;Hm?{w} Yeah, yeah.|Sorry, just...{w} why are there so many rules?|Can't I just cast it like normal?

s;SCarlinGrandpa;The greater the spell, the greater the constraints...{w} and, the greater the consequences for misuse.|This is no mere magician's parlor trick, but a genuine piece of sorcery!|Why, with magic like this, one could-
s;SCarlin;You said to plant my feet first, right?{w} Here goes!
s;SCarlinGrandpa;Hold a moment, Carlin!{w} I wasn't finished-!
# Carlin fires the spell at a training dummy, but it goes wide, incinerating a fence and blasting him backwards
s;SCarlinGrandpa;You...{w} you fool boy!{w} What did I just tell you!
s;SCarlin;Huh?{w} What're you so upset about?{w} It's just a fence.|I'll even fix it myself, promise!
s;SCarlin;But I just-!{w} I...{w} dang it.|Alright.{w} Here you go.

s;SCarlinGrandpa;This time, it was "just a fence."|But if there had been somebody there?{w} Or if you'd aimed slightly higher, and hit somebody's house?|If you do not understand the consequence of destruction, then I will not grant you the power to inflict it.
s;SCarlin;Okay...{w} I'm sorry, Grandpa, I just...{w} I thought-!
s;SCarlinGrandpa;You thought you knew what you were doing.{w} A mage must be free of hubris.|He must always-{w}{c:bop_portrait;SCarlinGrandpa} *cough* he must always be free of-{w} *cough cough*
s;SCarlin;Woah, are you alright?{w} Hey, what's the matter?|Grandpa?{w} Grandpa!?
s;Carlin;I thought you said I couldn't be trusted with it.

s;CarlinGrandpa;Well...{w} that was then.{w} This is now.|You ask me, this town...{w} it's been kindling for a while now.|With a spark this big...{w} well, it's bound to all catch flame.|Hardly matters if you lose control now, don't you think?
s;Carlin;I...{w} I don't understand.{w} Kindling?|I-I came to get you out, not for an old tome!
s;CarlinGrandpa;We both know I'm not getting out of this one alive.
s;Carlin;B-but...{w} that's not...|I can't just let you stay here!
s;CarlinGrandpa;You can.{w} And you will.|If the soldiers don't get me, this damned cough will.|Besides...{w} I would only slow you down.
s;Carlin;...{w} You're not gonna let me change your mind, are you?
s;CarlinGrandpa;Not this time.{w} Let an old man die on his own terms, boy{semicolon}|I've still got half a mug of ale and a warm bed to keep me company.
s;Carlin;Alright.{w} Alright, I'll...{w} I'll miss you, though.|I...{w} I'll really, really miss you...
s;CarlinGrandpa;Heh.{w} Quit your crying, boy.{w} I'll...{w} I'll miss you too.|Now, go on.{w} Go show those bastards what some old family magic can do!
s;Carlin;Okay!{w} I promise, I'll make you proud!
s;CarlinGrandpa;...{w} Ye gods, if there's an ounce of good left in any of you,{w} you'll see to it that that boy gets out of this alive...
update_achievement;3;Chaos Embraced;Viewed Carlin's Flashback in Ch1.
